metadata.title: As a student, I want to access a deployed application and see a 'Hello World' message from the backend, so that I know the core system is operational.

story.iWant: to access a deployed application and see a 'Hello World' message from the backend
story.soThat: I know the core system is operational.

subtask.description: Configure `vite.config.ts` for Vercel deployment if needed
Set up a new Vercel project, linking frontend and backend repositories
Deploy initial application to a public URL
Display a "Loading..." or placeholder message in `frontend/src/App.tsx`
Modify `frontend/src/App.tsx` to fetch initial message from backend `/api/chat` endpoint
Modify `api/chat.ts` to respond with a simple JSON object containing a "Hello World" message
Manually navigate to the public URL and confirm "Hello World" message is displayed, observing network requests to ensure it comes from the backend.
Create a new Supabase project and database instance
Obtain Supabase URL and Anon Key for future use
Confirm Supabase instance is active and accessible via Supabase Studio or API endpoint

acceptanceCriteria.criterion: A frontend and backend are initialized, connected, and deployed to a public URL.
When I navigate to the application's public URL, I see a 'Hello World' message originating from the backend.
The application includes a provisioned database, ready for future data integration.

constraint.description: Supabase (PostgreSQL with `pgvector` extension) will be provisioned
React Components: `PascalCase`, Files (non-component): `kebab-case`, Variables & Functions: `camelCase`, API Endpoints: `kebab-case` for paths, Database Tables/Columns: `snake_case`
Unit Tests (Vitest) and Integration Tests for API contract validation. Manual verification for UI/UX, performance, deployment, and basic accessibility.
All data in transit between frontend and backend will use HTTPS. API endpoint protection via rate limiting at Vercel edge.
Chatbot response time under 10 seconds. Frontend UI fluid and responsive.
Frontend setup using `npm create vite@7.2.4 sentiabot-frontend -- --template react-ts`
Google Gemini API will provide consistent and timely responses suitable for elementary school-level interactions.
Frontend and backend development can proceed in parallel with well-defined API contracts.
Deployment on Vercel will be straightforward and handle scaling for initial usage.
What specific error handling mechanisms should be implemented on the frontend for AI-related failures?
How will API keys for Google Gemini and Supabase be securely managed in the Vercel environment variables?

tests.standards: The project will use Vitest for unit testing. Testing strategy involves unit tests for both frontend (React components, Zustand stores, utilities) and backend (handler logic, Gemini integration). Integration tests will cover API contract validation and end-to-end chat flow. Manual testing will verify UI/UX, performance, deployment, and basic accessibility. Automated tools like Google Lighthouse and axe DevTools are planned for accessibility checks.
tests.locations: Frontend tests will likely reside within `frontend/src/**/*.test.ts(x)`. Backend tests will likely reside within `api/**/*.test.ts`.
